text: Walter Freer (born 1846) was a Scottish Liberal Party worker. He was the son of a notable Chartist and has been described as a "staunch Gladstonian".E. F. Biagini, Liberty, Retrenchment and Reform. Popular Liberalism in the Age of Gladstone, 1860-1880 (Cambridge University Press, 1992), p. 378, n. 43. He was also a power-loom tenter and temperance worker. ==Notes== ==Further reading== *Walter Freer, My Life and Memories (Glasgow: Civic Press, 1929). Category:1846 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Chartists Category:Scottish Liberal Party politicians Category:Scottish temperance activists
title: Walter Freer
